children.subject: I wouldn't do 61c with a full time job unless you know the material very well. I suggest booking an appointment with a CS major advisor to help you find a working schedule where you can graduate fast.
I’ll need to talk to an advisor to confirm this, but this isn’t a bad idea. My concern with this is that I won’t be paying UC student tuition over the summer.

If you calculate per unit summer tuition, it's actually on par or even cheaper than the regular semester tuition (unless you have a scholarship or financial aid, or take a lot of classes during the regular semester).

Have you considered graduating in Summer  2022 instead? Even if you’ve exceeded the unit cap, you can always enroll in summer courses. In the past 161 and 162 have been offered in the Summer, so if you go with schedule 1 and take either 161 or 162 in  Summer 2022, you will have a more manageable Spring schedule.

100% don't do a full time internship with 61c, that would be terrifyingly difficult.

Do you need to take 189? Because you haven't finished 70 yet I'm going to assume you haven't taken any probability course like 126 or Stat 140 or 134, and 189 tends to be harder (than it already is) if you don't have stronger probability experience than in CS 70. Doing something other than 189 would be a significantly easier spring 2022, and you can still learn a lot about ML later on without taking it.

For reference, I actually interned and took 161 (+ breadths) over last summer and managed to do fine in all of them. However, it took some pretty disciplined time management and I wouldn't want to do it again tbh.

I really enjoyed 61C, but lower-divs actually end up being more "work" than upper-divs IMO, though upper-divs take more time to understand the intuition but end up having less actual work. 

What I would do is try to take an upper div, like 188 or Data 100, over the summer (other than 162) and leave 61C for the semester. I really don't recommend anything over the summer w/ an internship, but if you must, I think an upper div is the way to go.

189 and 162 isn't exactly the best idea either... honestly taking 189 isn't necessary unless you are looking into grad school or your full time job will be heavily ML focused. I would recommend taking 186 (databases) or 168 (networking) as those are classes which are more directly relevant to what a fulltime swe will use/work on.
61c is the single most time-consuming class I took at CAL

Interned at a startup and took 61C (14 units total) last summer. I thought it was a hard time but doable, especially because I had a good home environment and couldn't do anything else besides work. Required time management, was stressful at times. Happy to answer any specific q's.

if the internship has the possibility of leading to a full-time offer, it would be best to focus whole-heartedly on that over the summer and not split your focus, especially with a time-consuming class like 61C. If you have other requirements left like breadths, online community college in summer should be doable with an internship (especially since the grade won't transfer) and will give you more breathing room during the semester.

161 is a great class but accelerated 61C over the summer may not give you a strong enough foundation to do well in 161, especially with an internship at the same time. I'd also encourage you to look at alternative CS upper divs that are less time-consuming than 189 and 162 - highly recommend the "chillest 3 classes in Spring 2022" option. Some classes to consider: CS186, CS168, Data 100, INFO 159, CS 160 (if you can get in), the 194s

history.content:
Long story short: I made a last-minute decision to switch majors to computer science and must graduate in spring 2022, since I am under L&S' unit cap. Consequently, I will have one term that will be extremely intense: summer 2021, fall 2021, or spring 2022. I will finish CS 70 by the end of this semester and will need to take 61C either this summer or fall 2021, since it is a prerequisite to the two classes I plan on taking: 161 and 162. My original plan was: 

Schedule 0: Before my internship opportunity came up

Summer 2021: 61C

Fall 2021: 188, 162

Spring 2022: 189, 161

However, I received a paid full-time internship offer for this summer from a startup, where I'll working with software. I am very doubtful that I can juggle an accelerated 61C and a full-time job at the same time, but I have crafted two schedules. 

Schedule 1: A very grueling spring 2022

Summer 2021: internship only

Fall 2021: 188, 61C

Spring 2022: 189, 161, 162

Schedule 2: A very grueling summer 2021

Summer 2021: internship AND 61C

Fall 2021: 188, 162

Spring 2022: 161, 189

I feel that this internship opportunity is too important for me to reject, since I have yet to have any software-related experience and the offer also comes with full-time salary employment after graduation. On the other hand, I don't want to fail any of my classes by overwhelming myself or tank my GPA. What do you suggest I go with? Alternatively, I am open to other scheduling schemes; one I thought of was having my spring 2022 consists of the Berkeley's chillest three upper-division CS courses. Please help a fellow bear in in panic mode! 😭😭😭
history.subject: SOS: Options of scheduling 3 techs in a semester versus an internship + 61C over the summer
